title: Dr. Scott Hahn - Letter and Spirit (13-part audio series + book)
description:
People often speak as if the Bible and the Mass were two very different realities. Anti-Catholics sometimes charge that the Bible and the Mass are somehow in competition with one another, but that's just not so. When we go deep in the history of God's people, we learn that the Bible is for the liturgy, and the liturgy is for the Bible. We learn, too, that the Bible is about the liturgy, and the liturgy is about the Bible. Dr. Scott Hahn joins Mike Aquilina to take on the lofty subject of the biblical roots of Catholic rites and the ritual roots of the Bible. He shows how scriptural texts have been intimately tied to ritual public worship since the early Christian church and even before that in the Jewish temple. 

The series is based on Dr. Hahn's book, "Letter and Spirit: From Written Text to Living Word in the Liturgy", which is included in a ZIP file in EPUB/MOBI/OPF/PDF formats.


13 MP3 files totaling nearly 6.5 hours


PART 1, THE LITURGY IN THE BIBLE, THE BIBLE IN THE LITURGY - Dr. Scott Hahn and Mike Aquilina examine the relationship between the Bible and Catholic Liturgy.

PART 2, THE GENESIS OF LITURGY - The roots of Catholic Liturgy back to the most ancient times recorded in the Bible

PART 3, CANON AND COVENANT - Exploring the canons, councils, and covenants that bind the books of the Bible into a single inspired volume.

PART 4, IT'S THE ECONOMY - The history and meaning of the Christian economy
